pullRequest.body:
This PR adds a CI action that tries to automatically label PRs with the appropriate `t-xxx` labels.

The script contains a "dictionary" to convert modified folders into `t-xxx` labels.
The script finds all possible labels for the files modified by the PR and, if there is exactly one possible label, applies it.

[Zulip discussion](https://leanprover.zulipchat.com/#narrow/stream/287929-mathlib4/topic/Auto-label.20PR.20topics)

---

In case it helps with reviewing, the action is adapted from the new contributor action.

<!-- The text above the `---` will become the commit message when your
PR is merged. Please leave a blank newline before the `---`, otherwise
GitHub will format the text above it as a title.

For details on the "pull request lifecycle" in mathlib, please see:
https://leanprover-community.github.io/contribute/index.html

In particular, note that most reviewers will only notice your PR
if it passes the continuous integration checks.
Please ask for help on https://leanprover.zulipchat.com if needed.

To indicate co-authors, include lines at the bottom of the commit message
(that is, before the `---`) using the following format:

Co-authored-by: Author Name <author@email.com>

If you are moving or deleting declarations, please include these lines at the bottom of the commit message
(that is, before the `---`) using the following format:

Moves:
- Vector.* -> Mathlib.Vector.*
- ...

Deletions:
- Nat.bit1_add_bit1
- ...

Any other comments you want to keep out of the PR commit should go
below the `---`, and placed outside this HTML comment, or else they
will be invisible to reviewers.

If this PR depends on other PRs, please list them below this comment,
using the following format:
- [ ] depends on: #abc [optional extra text]
- [ ] depends on: #xyz [optional extra text]

-->

[![Open in Gitpod](https://gitpod.io/button/open-in-gitpod.svg)](https://gitpod.io/from-referrer/)

nodes.body:
### PR summary [34c652c2bb](https://github.com/leanprover-community/mathlib4/pull/15848/commits/34c652c2bb33d8ada4cef3f49ce09d42023ac12d)

#### Import changes for modified files

No significant changes to the import graph


<details><summary>Import changes for all files</summary>

|Files|Import difference|
|-|-|

</details>

---

#### Declarations diff

No declarations were harmed in the making of this PR! üêô
<details>
  <summary>You can run this locally as follows</summary>


```bash
## summary with just the declaration names:
./scripts/declarations_diff.sh <optional_commit>

## more verbose report:
./scripts/declarations_diff.sh long <optional_commit>
```
</details>

The doc-module for `script/declarations_diff.sh` contains some details about this script.
Eventually, #17062 got merged.

The CI job looks plausible, the dictionary is well documented. (I have a few wording suggestions as usual.) My awk is still not that good - the printing logic in the end makes sense, but I can only guess what the middle part does.

I do wonder if writing a shell script with heavy awk is a good decision from the maintainance point of view. On the other hand, this script does not strike me as needing much maintenance (and should not be difficult to recreate, in the hopefully never occurring case that is needed).

Let's make this easier to understand for first-time readers:
```suggestion
          printf 'About to add the following labels: "%s"\n' "$(./scripts/autolabels.sh)"

How about moving this to the branch actually adding the labels, such as printing
"About to add labels by calling `'gh issue edit \'%s\' --add-label \'%s\'\n' "$NUMBER" "$LABELS"`"

I need to experiment with this: `$NUMBER` is actually read off via the workflow API and I do not really know if I can use it in a script that the API calls.

Besides, I am planning to rewrite the whole script in Lean, since I think that it will be easier to understand and maintain.

Waking up, I was wondering how long rewriting this in Python or Lean would take.
A Lean rewrite would be perfect!

What do you think? Optional.
```suggestion
This file contains the dictionary for converting a list of modified directories into a github label,

```suggestion
as well as a script to actually compute which label(s) to apply to the current changes.
How about "Dictionary entries must follow the following rules:" or so?
I like this, thanks!

```suggestion
* `Mathlib` is added by default to each "root folder".
"to easily distinguish it from `Tactic/anything_other_than_linter`"?
Also an improvement!
Is this a typo, and should be `Geometry/Euclidean`?
Indeed, it is a typo!  However, it would have probably matched regardless, since the matching is via regex and `.` matches anything!  :smile:
I would rather *not* apply `Init` here: that directory is a random mix of things.
Sorry for bringing this up now...
Removed it!  I should have removed it to begin with, but I was more focused on getting the script work, than actually looking at the labeling.
This sentence does not parse. Do you mean to delete the word "strips"?
Removed `strips`, thanks!

pullRequest.title: feat(CI): automatic labeling of PRs
